intro: Neanotis subtilis, commonly known as the slender neanotis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that typically range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia and is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. Due to its delicate appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for ornamental purposes.
